description:
Job Title: Staff Accountant

Position Type: Full-Time

Location: City of Industry, CA

Salary Range / Rate: $60,000 - $70,000

Job ID#: 141267

Position Summary

The Staff Accountant will report direct to the Accounting Manager and will be responsible for a variety of accounting tasks, including bank reconciliation, sales and use tax filing, and fixed asset maintenance. The Staff Accountant role requires a proactive approach to supporting our financial operations, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant laws and regulations.

Essential Tasks, Duties, & Responsibilities

  • Support month end closing process including preparation of accurate journal entries, account analysis and reconciliation.
  • Perform bank reconciliations to ensure accurate financial reporting and cash management.
  • Maintain fixed asset records, including depreciation schedules and asset verification.
  • Collaborate with external consultants on sales and use tax filings, ensuring timely submissions and adherence to state and federal regulations.
  • Assist with the preparation and filing of 571-L unsecured property tax returns.
  • Manage the renewal process for business licenses, ensuring compliance with local and state requirements. This includes overseeing and maintaining the company’s state online accounts related to tax and business filings.
  • Provide support during internal and external audits, including financial statement audit and royalty audits, to ensure all financial documentation is in order.
  • Take on additional projects as assigned by management, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability. This may include continuously updating existing SOP (standard operating procedures) or creating new ones.
  • Perform other duties as needed and directed by management.

Minimum Qualifications

Education & Experience

  • B.A. degree in accounting or related field preferred.
  • 2+ years of overall Finance or General Accounting experience.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting.
  • Proficiency with accounting software.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Exhibit an ability and eagerness to learn new skills and accounting practices and contributing to continuous improvement.
  • Intermediate to advance experience in MS Word, MS Excel.
  • Exhibit an ability and eagerness to learn new skills and accounting practices and contributing to continuous improvement.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, but are not a complete list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.
